name: Azerbaijan
partner: Civic Initiative for Democratic and EuroAtlantic Choice (Civic IDEA)
takeaway: Azerbaijani media maintains limited direct ties to PRC networks, with occasional affiliations in Belt and Road initiatives. While portraying positive relations, there is little evidence of substantial influence or echoing of PRC narratives on sensitive issues.

Azerbaijan exhibits a close diplomatic relationship with China, seen in a joint parliamentary friendship group and significant foreign aid alignment. However, the country tends to remain silent on sensitive topics, revealing a nuanced diplomatic stance.

Chinese influence in academia is evident through research partnerships and Confucius Institutes, but financial benefits or think tank affiliations are limited. While scholars haven't faced pressure for critical views, some have published articles echoing PRC talking points.

Azerbaijan's economic ties with China involve growing trade, but there's no significant evidence of PRC-connected entities exerting dominant economic influence. Collaborative efforts highlight economic cooperation without clear signs of substantial control.

Notable military collaboration exists between Azerbaijan and China, including agreements on military assistance, security dialogues, joint equipment development, and military education exchanges. This reflects a multifaceted and ongoing partnership in the military sphere.
description-1: In 2023, Azerbaijan had a GDP per capita of US$7,155 and a total population of 10.33 million people.
description-2: Azerbaijan established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1992. Azerbaijan was ranked 164th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Not Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 7/100.

Media.evidence: According to their website, there are not Azerbaijani media organizations that belong to the World Chinese Media Network.
Media.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

Media.evidence: In the article, there is a narrative that Uyghur’s genocide is a campaign conducted by the west to influence or pressure China.
Media.note: The U.S. is expanding the front of the war with China not only in the commercial and technological areas but also in the information area with its propaganda materials, especially concerning the situation of the Uygurs in the Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region. The author of the article is Azerbaijani. The author analyses the Uygur issue as a disinformation campaign of the US.                                                          https://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/201912/29/WS5e08035ba310cf3e3558146c.html            According to the article, in Azerbaijan some people perceived Uyghur’s issue as a disinformation campaign of the West against China. So, these people denied any human rights violation of Muslims living in China and they shared some photos showing/proving that Muslims have the right/opportunity of religious expression in China.                                   https://musavat.com/news/cin-heqiqetleri_276954.html

Foreign Policy.evidence:
Azerbaijan recognizes the great importance of relations with China. It supports China's principled position on Taiwan, Tibet, Xinjiang, and Falun Gong issues.

Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev stated that he supports China's position on the issues of Taiwan, and Tibet.

Azerbaijan supports the "One China" principle. Assistant to the President of Azerbaijan, and executive director of the Heydar Aliyev Foundation, Anar Alakbarov stated this during a meeting with the Deputy Foreign Minister of the People's Republic of China, Ma Caosyu.

Ilham Aliyev: Azerbaijan supports one-China principle. (2015)

Academia.evidence:
Confucius Institute has been opened at Baku State University

Confucius Institute at Azerbaijan University of Languages

The branch of the Confucius Institute opens at Khazar University

ADA University and the Confucius Institute under the Baku State University have signed a cooperation agreement that will see the organization of Chinese language classes for ADA students.

Azerbaijan State Telegraph Agency (AzerTAc) and Confucius Institute under the Baku State University have today signed a cooperation agreement and a branch of the institute was opened at the agency.

The first Confucius Institute in Azerbaijan was opened in April 2011 at Baku State University with the participation of the Chargé d’Affaires of the Chinese Embassy. 

A seminar on the implementation of the "One Belt, One Road" initiative was held at the Confucius Institute of Baku State University (BSU) together with a delegation of BSU scholars led by Li Rengu, party organization secretary of Anhui University.

A cooperation agreement was signed between Azerbaijan University and the Confucius Institute at Baku State University.

AZERTAC and Confucius Institute are planning to implement new joint projects.

AZERTAC and Confucius Institute have been cooperating for almost 8 years. The institute's teachers conduct Chinese language classes for the agency's employees and familiarize them with Chinese culture. In addition, the agency regularly provides informational support to the institute's events across the country.

On June 23, the opening ceremony of the first "Confucius class" in Azerbaijan was held with the joint efforts of the Confucius Institute of Baku State University and Khazar University.

The Confucius Center was opened at Azerbaijan University. The university said that the center will operate in the framework of cooperation with the Confucius Institute at Baku State University. The center also plans to study Chinese culture and teach the Chinese language.

Domestic Politics.evidence:
Azerbaijan-China Relations:

Azerbaijan president noted that he is pleased that Xi Jinping called the President of Azerbaijan a big friend of China + President Ilham Aliyev emphasized that cooperation with China is one of the main priorities of Azerbaijan`s foreign policy.

Eltun Süleymanov, deputy chairman of the Public Council at the Nasimi RIH:
"We have very good cooperation within international institutions. We always support each other's territorial integrity and sovereignty. We have built a very solid political platform. Now we are building our economic cooperation on it. This is very important in today's situation because there are new challenges, new problems and new opportunities. We hope to see more Chinese companies in Azerbaijan."

MP Sahib Aliyev's visit to APA.

Ilham Aliyev was interviewed by China Media Group media corporation:
"I had the chance to meet President Xi Jinping many times in China, and also on the sidelines of international events. I have great respect for him. I always was impressed with his vision, his intelligence, openness, and deep awareness of bilateral relations between us. Because China as a global power has a very broad foreign policy agenda, much broader than one of Azerbaijan’s.

China’s Huawei Technologies Co. Ltd. will help the Azerbaijani Ministry of Transport, Communications and High Technologies to implement the Smart City project in Baku and Azerbaijan’s districts, says Marco Xu, Huawei vice-president for Central Asia and Caucasus.                                                     “Our aim is to help the ministry to create the Smart City. Such components as the Smart Transport, Smart Port, Smart Trade and others will be implemented at the next stages,” Xu said, adding that each of these components has specific solutions that will be implemented step-by-step.                          -https://www.azerbaijan-news.az/posts/detail/huawei-en-son-qabaqcil-texnologiyalarini-qarabagda-tetbiq-edecek-1619533465
"Huawei" is ready to present the latest advanced technologies in Karabakh and participate in the development of "Smart Villages" in the future: "As a leading supplier of "Smart City" and "Smart Village" technologies, our company has extensive experience in this field and we have more than 100 global projects is available. We will supply the latest products and technologies to provide advanced technologies for the "Smart Village" in Karabakh. We will use "Gigabit AirPON" technology for the first time in Azerbaijan. This technology can shorten the laying of fiber-optic lines from 10 kilometers to 1 kilometer. In this way, we can speed up the construction of the network and save costs."                                https://azertag.az/en/xeber/Huawei_to_apply_its_most_advanced_technologies_in_Karabakh-1767419                                           “The first phase of the "Smart Village" project will feature the creation of a safe living environment, as well as the implementation of "smart education", "smart health" and "smart agriculture" systems in Karabakh,” the CEO added.

News from China Youth Daily (中国青年报) shows that the Confucius Institute in the Azerbaijan University of Languages held a cultural and language exchange event in November 2023, including exchange experiences sharing of college students and participation of local primary and middle school students. the Confucius Institute of Azerbaijan University of Languages is one of the most active organizations promoting Chinese culture and language. The institute often carries out cultural events. 1. on February 19, 2024, a lecture on "Chinese paper art" was held at the Confucius Institute of AUL. (Source: https://adu.edu.az/az/xeberler/xeberler/8008.html )  2. On October 4, 2023, the Confucius Institute participated in the exhibition of Chinese companies. (Source: https://adu.edu.az/az/xeberler/xeberler/7547.html )  3. On September 7, 2023, an event about "Confucius and Music" was held at the Confucius Institute of AUL.  (Source: https://adu.edu.az/az/xeberler/xeberler/7476.html )  4. On July 28, 2023, the lecture was held at the Confucius Institute of AUL. The event was dedicated to the 96th anniversary of the establishing of the Chinese People's Liberation Army. (Source: https://adu.edu.az/az/xeberler/xeberler/7410.html )  5. On June 22, 2023, the Chinese Dragon Boat Festival was celebrated at the Confucius Institute. (Source: https://adu.edu.az/az/xeberler/xeberler/7344.html )

China once again provided free military property assistance to Azerbaijan for 3 million yuan. -                       According to Azeridefence, after the agreement was signed in 2013, various types of winter and summer tents, medical tents, 10 rubber boats, and 24 RAFT-A-10 life rafts were sent from China to the Azerbaijani army for their units.                                        https://bakuresearchinstitute.org/en/azerbaijan-china-relations-2/                                        The Polonez multi-launch missile system sent from Belarus to Azerbaijan was developed jointly with China. Azerbaijan also purchased a Turkish-made Kasirga (Hurricane) T-300 system under a Chinese license, and China has offered several other systems to the Azerbaijani army.                   https://crudeaccountability.org/beyond-oil-examining-chinas-influence-in-azerbaijan/

Military.evidence:
https://mod.gov.az/az/pre/25450.html 
Today, relations between the two countries in the field of military education are at a high level.
According to the agreement reached in the field of military education, representatives of the Azerbaijani Army are studying in the Russian-speaking group at the "High Strategic Command" course. Participation in the course and the high conditions created there allow you to get acquainted with the history, culture and achievements of China. Sightseeing and familiarization tours organized to other cities, scientific research centers, military industrial complexes, military commands, units and military educational institutions, as well as museums and historical places serve to create a broad perception of China.
http://femida.az/az/news/48230/Çində-xüsusi-təlim-keçmiş-aprel-şəhidi---Məhəbbət-Mirzəyevin-həyat-hekayəsi In
After successfully completing the Special Forces military course, most of Mahabbat Mirzaev’s colleagues chose him and his friend Elvin and sent him to Guangzhou, People's Republic of China on August 18, 2015 for special training. Here he mastered all the secrets of the shooter-sniper profession and the military.
https://az.trend.az/azerbaijan/society/3462950.html 
With the help of the People's Liberation Army of China, more than 100 officers of the Azerbaijani army received relevant courses in China. China is also interested in developing cooperation with Azerbaijan in the military-technical field, promoting military and dual-use technologies, using the scientific and constructive potential of Azerbaijan.                                           The joint declaration signed by the leaders of the two countries in 2015 states that the parties are ready to continue practical cooperation in the exchange of military delegations, the training of military personnel, military assistance, and other forms. According to the agreement reached in the field of military education, representatives of the Azerbaijani Army are studying in China as part of a Russian-language group at the “High Strategic Command” course.                                          https://bakuresearchinstitute.org/en/azerbaijan-china-relations-2/
